items.content_html: Fixes issue #4068
items.title: Fixes #4068

items.content_html:
Before:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ParentNode/firstElementChild
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ParentNode/lastElementChild

After:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/firstElementChild
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/firstElementChild
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment/firstElementChild

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/lastElementChild
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/lastElementChild
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment/lastElementChild

IDL:

interface mixin ParentNode {
  readonly attribute Element? firstElementChild;
  readonly attribute Element? lastElementChild;
};
Document includes ParentNode;
DocumentFragment includes ParentNode;
Element includes ParentNode;
items.title: Demix Parentnode.{first,last}ElementChild to Element, Document, DocumentFragment pages

items.content_html:
Moving (the useful document) https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/Events/Creating_and_triggering_events out from the "events guide" under the Event Reference. The redirect is automatic, but I also manually fixed up a lot of the links.

In addition,

  • to make the sub documents visible, I have added a sidebar section which displays the sub pages and other key docs.
  • Deleted sub doc "touchstart" which duplicated equivalent event docs under Element and Document
  • Moved sub doc "periodicsync" under ServiceWorkerGlobalScope as that is where is is defined. Have not yet put a link IN ServiceWorkerGlobalScope - I want a sanity check on this.

There are a couple more comments/questions inline.
items.title: Move creating and triggering events etc

items.content_html:
This change adds an example to the SVG “transform-origin” article. The example is based on code snippets from a Stack Overflow question (with attribution give, and with a link to the CC BY-SA license).

The purpose of the example is in part to demonstrate how the same transformation that can be performed with transform-origin can also be performed with transform only (which is useful for targeting browsers that don’t have support for transform-origin — or that don’t support it as expected).

Related: mdn/browser-compat-data#9834
items.title: Add an example to the SVG “transform-origin” doc

items.content_html:
Updates the requirements on actions/cache to permit the latest version.

Release notes

Sourced from actions/cache's releases.

v2.1.5

  • Fix permissions error seen when extracting caches with GNU tar that were previously created using BSD tar (actions/cache#527)
Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: chore(deps): update actions/cache requirement to v2.1.5

items.content_html:
Fixes #4000

@mdn/core-dev

The problem here is that when a Compat macro is used within a document, Yari seems to move it to being the first following sibling of the nearest previous h3 in the document — even if there’s other content which follows that same h3 before the point in the source where the Compat macro is placed.

So the initial commit in this PR branch attempts to work around that by adding an empty <h3></h3> element just before the Compat macro — like this:

 <p> … The below table shows the compat data for the {{cssxref("shape-outside")}} property.</p>
+ <h3><!-- intentionally blank; hack to force placement of table --></h3>
 <p>{{Compat("css.properties.shape-outside")}}</p>

Otherwise, without that <h3></h3> heading added, Yari takes the <p>{{Compat("css.properties.shape-outside")}}</p> output and moves it so it renders above that <p> … The below table shows the compat data paragraph rather than below it.

But if adding an empty heading like that is too ugly of a hack, then an alternative would be to replace this:

The below table shows the compat data for the {{cssxref("shape-outside")}} property.

…with:

For an example, see <a href="/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/shape-outside#browser_compatibility">the compat data table for the shape-outside property</a>.

…which seems suboptimal, since it means that users would need to navigate away just to see an example of what a compat table looks like. So I guess another alternative would be to replace it with a screenshot.
items.title: Fix placement of compat table in “Debugging CSS” doc
fix: flaws in web/api/w* batch 1
